definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He sprained (strained, wrenched) his ankle by a fall.
sentences.chinese: 他摔了一跤扭了脚脖子。

sentences.english: He sprained his ankle when playing football.
sentences.chinese: 他踢足球时扭伤了脚脖子。

sentences.english: A:Peter sprained his ankle just now.
sentences.chinese: 刚才彼得扭伤了脚脖子。

sentences.english: Mosquitoes were using my ankles for filling stations.
sentences.chinese: 蚊子们把我的脚脖子当作加油站。

sentences.english: I sprained my ankle when playing basketball yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天打篮球时扭伤了脚脖子。

sentences.english: Peter sprained hi ankle just now.
sentences.chinese: 刚才彼得扭伤了脚脖子。

sentences.english: His veins had swelled with the effort of the cough, and the varicose ulcer had started itching.
sentences.chinese: 这阵子咳嗽，直叫他静脉贲张，脚脖子也刺痒起来。

sentences.english: Mosquitos are using my ankle for filling station.
sentences.chinese: 蚊子们把我的脚脖子当作加油站。

sentences.english: I tickled him with a feather.
sentences.chinese: 他又伸下手去搔一搔脚脖子。

sentences.english: I threw in the dirt. When it was up to their ankles , that girl started to sing.
sentences.chinese: 当土埋到他们脚脖子的时候，那个姑娘开始唱歌。

sentences.english: Peter sprained his ankle just now.
sentences.chinese: 刚才彼得扭伤了脚脖子。

sentences.english: He tried to jump over the rail,but he botched it and twisted his ankle.
sentences.chinese: 他企图跃过栏杆，但他没跳好，扭伤了他的脚脖子。

definition: calf (back of the leg below the knee)
